EPA RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
TYSON FRESH MEATS, Inc.- Eagle Mountain, UT

1. Accident Release Prevention Program and Emergency Response Policy

It is the policy of the TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC., Eagle Mountain, UT facility management to implement the requirements of
this Risk Management Program (RMP) in accordance with the USEPA regulations under 40 CFR Part 68 and with the
corresponding regulations under OSHA's Process Safety Management(PSM)program. The objective is to minimize the risk of a
release of a hazardous material and if a release occurs, to minimize the potential impact to TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC
employees, the public and the environment. This objective will be accomplished by utilizing generally accepted good operating procedures,
providing appropriate training to all employees, and coordinating response activities, as necessary, with the local emergency
response providers. This plan covers all TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC owned activities at this facility.

TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC.'s management is committed to providing the resources necessary to implement this policy.

2. Facility Description

TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC built a new meat processing facility at this location. Various meat cuts are trucked to the plant and 
processed into raw meat products. Support operations include cold storage and administrative offices.
One chemical is utilized at the facility in sufficient quantities to be subject to the requirements of 40 CFR Part 68. This chemical is
ammonia and is used as a refrigerant throughout the facility. 

3. General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

The Eagle Mountain, UT facility is governed by a set of OSHA and USEPA regulations that require planning and facility activities
intended to prevent a release of hazardous material, or if a release inadvertently occurs, to minimize the consequences of a release
to the employees of the facility, the public and to the environme

nt. These regulations include:
40 CFR Part 68, Accidental Release Prevention
* 40 CFR Part 112, Spill Prevention, Control and Countermeasure
* 40 CFR Part 264, Hazardous Waste Contingency Plan
* 29 CFR Part 119, Process Safety Management
* 40 CFR Part 302, Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act (EPCRA)
The key concepts in TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC's release prevention program are employee participation, appropriate design and maintenance of
equipment, and appropriate training of all employees. TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC. has developed and documented these elements in their
process safety management plan (PSM). The PSM plan is incorporated with this document by reference.
Employee participation in the release prevention program is encouraged and supported by Tyson Foods management. Key
personnel are responsible for conducting and implementing the findings from the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) for the ammonia
systems. Tyson Foods employees are also members of the facility emergency response team.
TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC's  policy is to construct all new equipment, systems, and facilities to ensure the appropriate safety and release
prevention systems are included from the beginning of each project. TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC. maintains a computerized program of
maintenance activities to ensure that key systems are maintained appropriately to minimize the risk of a release.
TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC. is committed to providing appropriate training to all employees regarding safety procedures. Each new employee is
provided comprehensive safety training during their initial orientation for the facility. In addition, TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC. conducts regularly
scheduled safety training for all employees each year. Additional training is provided to maintenance personnel for the systems
they are responsible for, this includes PPE training.

4. Five Year Accident History

This is a new facility, so there is no accident history within the last 5 years.

5

. Emergency Response Program

TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC. Eagle Mountain Facility plans to maintain an onsite hazmat team. Until the team is fully equipped and trained per the facility ERP, there has been coordination with the local fire department as the primary responders for all emergencies at the facility.
This team will be trained to the Hazardous Materials Responder-Technician response capability in accordance with OSHA 29 CFR 1910.120 (q). 
The team will be capable of affecting all control measures (both confinement operations and containment operations) required to remediate the incident.
A written Emergency Response Plan has been developed and is on record at the Facility. Personnel Roles and Lines of Incident Command Authority, 
Facility Hazard Analysis and Emergency Prevention, Safe Distances and Places of Refuge, Site Security and Control, Evacuation Routes and Procedures,
Decontamination Procedures, provisions for Emergency Medical Treatment, Emergency Notification Procedures, Chemical
Response Procedures, Post Incident Critique, and Personal Protective Clothing and Emergency Equipment.
All Hazmat courses at TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC are designed to meet training requirements of the OSHA 29 CFR 1910.120 (q) (7) and (8).
All Hazmat Team Members are trained 24 hours initially to the Technician level followed by 8-24 hours of refresher training per year.
The training is designed to teach both theory and hands-on training giving the person an overall understanding of the nature of
hazardous materials and the ability to assess and safely respond to the incidents in the Incident Command structure. Technician

6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC completes a thorough review of the ammonia system each time a design change is implemented. 
TYSON FRESH MEATS, INC is committed to using these methods to identify and implement ways to improve the safety of these systems.
